title: 2018–19 Dynamo Dresden season
text:
The <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20in%20German%20football">2018–19</a> <a href="Dynamo%20Dresden">Dynamo Dresden</a> season was the 69th season in the <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club's history and <a href="List%20of%20clubs%20in%20the%20Bundesliga">third consecutive season</a> in the second division of <a href="German%20football%20league%20system">German football</a>, the <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> and 8th overall. In addition to the <a href="Football%20in%20Germany%23Bundesliga">domestic league</a>, Dynamo Dresden also competed in this season's edition of the <a href="Football%20in%20Germany%23German%20Cup">domestic cup</a>, the <a href="DFB-Pokal">DFB-Pokal</a>. The season covered a period from 1 July 2018 to 30 June 2019.
Season summary.
On 22 August 2018, Dynamo parted company with manager <a href="Uwe%20Neuhaus">Uwe Neuhaus</a>. He was replaced by <a href="Cristian%20Fi%C3%A9l">Cristian Fiél</a> on an interim basis, before <a href="Maik%20Walpurgis">Maik Walpurgis</a> was appointed as his permanent replacement on 11 September 2018. Malpurgis was sacked in February 2019, with <a href="Cristian%20Fi%C3%A9l">Cristian Fiél</a> appointed as his replacement.
